column1: Prachuap Khiri Khan (Thai: ประจวบคีรีขันธ์
column2: pronounced [prā.t͡ɕùa̯p.kʰīː.rīː.kʰǎn]) is one of the western provinces (changwat) of Thailand. It is in the northern part of the Malay Peninsula
column3: some 240 km (149 mi) south of Bangkok. Neighboring provinces include Phetchaburi to the north and Chumphon to the south. To the west
column4: it borders Tanintharyi Region of Myanmar.

column1: Prachuap Khiri Khan covers an area totaling 6
column3: 458 sq mi). The province is on the Kra Isthmus
column4: the narrow land bridge connecting the Malay Peninsula with mainland Asia. The province has the narrowest part of Thailand
column5: just 12.38 km (7.69 mi) from the Gulf of Thailand to the border with Myanmar in the Tenasserim Hills. Geographically
column6: Prachuap Khiri Khan is a moderate plain with elevations varying from sea level to 1
column8: 900 ft). The maximum elevations are found in the northeastern and central west regions
column9: which make up approximately 30 percent of the province.

column1: The long coast of the Gulf of Thailand has many sandy beaches. One of the best known
column3: has been a popular resort since King Prajadhipok (Rama VII) built a summer palace there. From the coast the land quickly rises into the Tenasserim Hills
column4: the mountain chain that forms the border with Myanmar. Due to its narrow watershed
column5: the rivers in the province are all small. The only one of significance is the Pranburi River in the north. Among the smaller rivers is the Khlong Kui.Prachuap Khiri Khan has a dubbed as "Mueang Sam Ao"
column9: and Ao Manao all three bights are lined up. All are located in the area of Mueang Prachuap Khiri Khan District.Khao Sam Roi Yot National Park was established in 1966 to protect Thailand's largest freshwater marshes. The park contains some mangrove forests and mudflats. Most of the marshes were converted into shrimp farms
column10: despite being in a national park.

column1: The city of Muang Na Rang was reconstructed in 1845
column2: after it had been abandoned during the fall of the Ayutthaya Kingdom in 1767. The town was rebuilt at the mouth of the Ron River and renamed "Prachuap Khiri Khan"

column1: King Mongkut gathered the people of three towns—Bang Nangrom
column3: and Khlong Wan—and resettled them in the rebuilt city. At the same time
column4: he renamed a portion of what is now Trat Province and Koh Kong Province in Cambodia "Patchan Khiri Khet". The name was chosen to rhyme with "Prachuap Khiri Khan" on the opposite side of the Gulf of Thailand at the same latitude.In 1868
column5: King Mongkut invited foreign guests to the province to watch a solar eclipse he had predicted for 18 August. The dignitaries viewed it from an observation point in the marshes near Sam Roi Yot. He contracted malaria
column6: of which he died on 1 October.

column1: In the reign of King Rama II
column2: a new city was established at the mouth of the I Rom Canal known as Muang Bang Nang Rom. Prachuap became a seaside resort during the reign of King Rama V. Besides tourism
column3: the province is heavily agricultural. Coconuts are a major crop. As much as 40 percent of farmers in Prachuap Khiri Khan solely cultivate coconuts.At the beginning of World War II
column4: Japanese troops invaded Thailand. On 8 December 1941
column5: they struck first near the city of Prachuap Khiri Khan. After resisting the Japanese in the Battle of Prachuap Khiri Khan
column6: after several hours the defenders were ordered to cease fire by the government in Bangkok.

column2: 000 years old cave paintings was announced by archaeologists from the Fine Arts Office in a cave at the Khao Sam Roi Yod National Park in May in 2020. Some of the depicted pictures are still visible and clear
column3: while some paintings were damaged by limestone etching. According to archeologist Kannika Premjai
column4: paintings describe humanlike figures with accessories on their bodies
column5: hunting scenes with bow and arrow. Moreover
column6: there is also an animal figure seems to be serow (a goat-like mammal found regionally) found among the drawings.

column1: The provincial seal shows the Kuha Karuhas Pavilion
column2: which was built when King Chulalongkorn (Rama V) visited the Praya Nakorn Cave (Sam Roi Yot District). Depicted behind the pavilion is the island of Ko Lak in Prachuap Bay

column1: The provincial tree as well as the provincial flower is the rayan or manilkara (Manilkara hexandra). Milkfish (Chanos chanos) is a provincial fish.The provincial slogan is 'City of pure gold
The province is divided into eight districts (amphoes). The districts are further divided into 48 subdistricts (tambons) and 388 villages (mubans).

As of 26 November 2019 there are: one Prachuap Khiri Khan Provincial Administration Organisation (ongkan borihan suan changwat) and 16 municipal (thesaban) areas in the province. Prachuap Khiri khan and Hua Hin have town (thesaban mueang) status. Further 14 subdistrict municipalities (thesaban tambon). The non-municipal areas are administered by 44 Subdistrict Administrative Organisations - SAO (ongkan borihan suan tambon).
AirHua Hin Airport is in Hua Hin District. AirAsia serves the airport with a direct flight to Kuala Lumpur that commenced on 18 May 2018.
RailThe railway in Prachuap Khiri Khan is on the southern route from Bangkok. There are five major stations in Prachuap Khiri Khan: Hua Hin Railway Station
column5: and Bang Saphan Noi Railway Station.

column1: RoadPrachuap is on Thailand Route 4 (Phetkasem Road)
column2: which links the central region with the south.
United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) in Thailand has tracked progress on human development at sub-national level using the Human achievement index (HAI)
column3: a composite index covering all the eight key areas of human development. National Economic and Social Development Board (NESDB) has taken over this task since 2017.

column1: Thailand's royal family and especially former kings were the first to set this location on the map as the original seashore destination in Thailand. The long white sandy beaches themselves are clean and pretty. Besides sunbathing snorkeling and swimming
